result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathaniel J. Crucianelli was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Alcohol / drug;  Anger management / DV counseling;   Psychiatric/psychological;  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
++  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
++  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations.  May Not have contact with felons, drug dealers unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.   May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

State of Wisconsin appears by Deputy District Attorney Angelina Gabriele. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Barth. Clerk/H. Barnett. Court imposes a total sentence of 3 years WSP, concurrent to 17CF1320:  1 year initial confinement w/credit for 40 days served; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; pay $250 DNA surcharge. No contact with felons or drug dealers.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  Attorney Watson spoke w/ DE's sponsor & was advised he will be welcomed back to the sober house.  Discussion held.  Court modifies bond to a $2,500.00 signature bond.  DE is to remain at the sober house.  If there is a change in the DE's living arrangements, the Court is to be notified immediately.  All other bond conditions remain.  Matter remains on the court's calendar for 2/19/2016 at 8:30am.
